objectives

¢ Describe how claim setup rules execute claim
setup

¢ Write presetup rules

¢ Write segmentation rules

¢ Describe the rules executed for exposure and
activity setup

| Automated claim setup

¢ Aseries of rules designed to:
« Execute any work required for generating the claim, which can be done automatically
+ Example: Generating a list of activities to complete
« Ensure that the claim is ready for adjudication
* Sometimes referred to as SAW:
* segment
* Assign

Automated Claim Setup
. Workplan Cee eee eeeeeeeneneeeeeeneneececccnceeeneerseerececcccncananccoaannassnnsnsnngs *

| Claim setup rules

¢ Series of rules executed to complete claim setup
*« Some are exclusive to setup
*« Some are used outside of setup

¢ For most of these rules, there are both claim-level
and exposure-level rules

| Preupdate and validation rules

¢ Executed for all objects (including
claims and exposures), whenever the
object is created or changed

¢ Preupdate rules

* Make changes or additions to object before
validating and saving

Validation rules

¢ Execute only if the object is Validatable

« Reject object if data is not correct and/or

complete

the future

Presetup rules

| Presetup rules

¢ Five entities have presetup rule sets

¢ Executed whenever object of that type
is created

¢ During claim setup:
* Claim presetup rules are run

¢ Exposure and activity presetup are run for
each exposure and activity created during
setup

Presetup

#) ActivityPresetup

#) ClaimPresetup

#) ExposurePresetup

#) MatterPresetup

#) TransactionSetPresetup

| Presetup rules automatically create Workers Comp [
exposures
¢« WC claims create exposures automatically upon intake based on Yes/No answers
in the NCW and Loss Details
*« The mechanism ClaimCenter uses to create WC exposures during the NCW is
provided in the presetup rule CPRO1000 — WCDefaultExposures

| Exposure and activity setup G

* Claim setup only occurs at the time a claim is created

* Only once at the start of the claims process

¢ Exposure and Activity setup occurs upon Exposure and Activity creation

« May occur multiple times during the claims process

created, this series of rules is executed

(except the activity rules) Assignment

| Activity setup rules

¢ After claim setup, when an activity is
created, this series of rules is executed

¢ All are activity-level

« Note that activities are not segmented, have
no workplan, and no reserves

Question

_- — Which rule set category does not provide rules for both claims and

Pa exposures?
¢

SS Seeoesese sees ee ese

Answer G

,- — Which rule set category does not provide rules for both claims and
Ks exposures?
¢
The correct answer is Initial Reserve rules, which provides rules only at the exposure
level.

SS eeesee seen ee ese

Question G

a wa a rule set category do exposure rules run before claim rules?

7
¢

SS Seeoesese sees ee ese

Answer Gi

_— — For which rule set category do exposure rules run before claim rules?
7 Why?
¢

The correct answer is Segmentation. Exposure rules are run first because claim
segmentation typically depends upon the outcome of exposure segmentation.

SS eeesee seen ee ese

Question

_— — What type of objects are most likely to be created in
Ka (a) Presetup rules?
: (b) Workplan rules?

SS Seeoesese sees ee ese

Answer

,— — What type of objects are most likely to be created in
Ks (a) Presetup rules?
: (b) Workplan rules?

The correct answer is for (a) Presetup rules, is exposures.
The correct answer is for (b) Workplan rules is activities.

SS eeesee seen ee ese

Question

_— — Which claim-evel rule set categories are also executed outside of claim
Ka setup?
¢

For each, give a non-claim setup example of when they might run.

SS Seeoesese sees ee ese

Gi

Answer Gi

,- — Which claim-evel rule set categories are also executed outside of claim

Ks setup?
¢

For each, give a non-claim setup example of when they might run.

The correct answers are:

Assignment rules — Run whenever an object such as an activity is reassigned using
automated assignment.

Preupdate rules — Run whenever an object such as an exposure is created or
modified.

Validation rules — Run whenever an object such as an activity is created or modified.

SS eeesee seen ee ese

Question

_— — Inthe diagram, what rule sets are included
: in “activity rules”? Segmentation

7
¢

Initial Reserve

SS Seeoesese sees ee ese

Answer

_— — Inthe diagram, what rule sets are included
7 in “activity rules”?
¢

The correct answer is activity presetup,
activity assignment, activity postsetup,
activity preupdate, and activity validation.

Presetup

¢ After claim setup, when an exposure is
created, this series of rules is executed

Segmentation
¢ All are exposure-level

(except the activity rules) Assignment

Workplan

activity rules H

Postsetup

Initial Reserve

Preupdate

Validation

| Activity setup rules

¢ After claim setup, when an activity is
created, this series of rules is executed

¢ All are activity-level

« Note that activities are not segmented, have
no workplan, and no reserves

Question

_- — Which rule set category does not provide rules for both claims and

Pa exposures?
¢

SS Seeoesese sees ee ese

Answer G

,- — Which rule set category does not provide rules for both claims and
Ks exposures?
¢
The correct answer is Initial Reserve rules, which provides rules only at the exposure
level.

Question G

a wa a rule set category do exposure rules run before claim rules?

7
¢

SS Seeoesese sees ee ese

Answer Gi

_— — For which rule set category do exposure rules run before claim rules?
7 Why?
¢

The correct answer is Segmentation. Exposure rules are run first because claim
segmentation typically depends upon the outcome of exposure segmentation.

Question

_— — What type of objects are most likely to be created in
Ka (a) Presetup rules?
: (b) Workplan rules?

SS Seeoesese sees ee ese

Answer

,— — What type of objects are most likely to be created in
Ks (a) Presetup rules?
: (b) Workplan rules?

The correct answer is for (a) Presetup rules, is exposures.
The correct answer is for (b) Workplan rules is activities.

SS eeesee seen ee ese

Question

_— — Which claim-evel rule set categories are also executed outside of claim
Ka setup?
¢

For each, give a non-claim setup example of when they might run.

SS Seeoesese sees ee ese

Gi

Answer Gi

,- — Which claim-evel rule set categories are also executed outside of claim

Ks setup?
¢

For each, give a non-claim setup example of when they might run.

The correct answers are:

Assignment rules — Run whenever an object such as an activity is reassigned using
automated assignment.

Preupdate rules — Run whenever an object such as an exposure is created or
modified.

Validation rules — Run whenever an object such as an activity is created or modified.
